Notes: carried out Shuttle Radar Tomography Mission
completed docking of Russian-built Zvezda module to ISS
mounted solar arrays on Z1 truss
addition of U.S.-built Destiny laboratory module to ISS
delivery of Expedition 2 crew (Usachyov, Voss, Helms) and European Space Agency (ESA)-built logistics module Leonardo to ISS
added Canadian robotic arm Canadarm2 to ISS
addition of U.S.-built Quest airlock to ISS
delivery of Expedition 3 crew (Culbertson, Tyurin, Dezhurov) and ESA-built logistics module Leonardo to ISS
exchange of Soyuz return craft for ISS crew
delivery of Expedition 4 crew (Onufriyenko, Bursch, Walz) and ESA-built logistics module Raffaello to ISS
delivered Expedition 5 crew (Whitson, Korzun, Treschyov) and equipment to ISS
exchange of Soyuz return craft for ISS crew
delivered Expedition 6 crew (Bowersox, Budarin, Pettit) and P1 truss to ISS
first Israeli astronaut (Ramon); crew killed when vehicle broke up during reentry
first Ansari X Prize competition flight
first space shuttle flight after Columbia disaster
Expedition 13 crew (Vinogradov, Williams) to ISS; first Brazilian astronaut (Pontes)
increased ISS crew from two to three (Reiter)
connected new solar array to ISS electric system; first Swedish astronaut (Fuglesang); longest spaceflight by a woman (Williams; 194 days 18 hours)
Expedition 16 crew (Whitson, Malenchenko) to ISS; first Malaysian astronaut (Sheikh)
added ESA Columbus laboratory module to ISS
added Canadian robot Dextre to ISS
Expedition 17 crew (Volkov, Kononenko) to ISS; first second-generation cosmonaut (Volkov); first Korean astronaut (Yi)
added Japanese Kibo laboratory module to ISS
Expedition 18 crew (Fincke, Lonchakov) to ISS; first second-generation American astronaut (Garriott)
delivered equipment that would allow a six-person crew on the ISS
added final solar array to ISS
Expeditions 19 and 20 crew (Padalka, Barratt); first repeat space tourist (Simonyi)
final servicing mission to Hubble Space Telescope
Expeditions 20 and 21 crew; brought ISS to full crew of six
added facility exposed to space to the Japanese Kibo module
delivery of ESA-built logistics module Leonardo to ISS
delivery of spare parts to ISS
delivery of European Space Agency (ESA)-built logistics module Leonardo to ISS
delivery of Russian-built Mini Research Module to ISS
delivery of robot Robonaut 2 and ESA-built Permanent Multipurpose Module to ISS; last flight of Discovery; first astronaut on consecutive shuttle flights (Bowen)
delivery of Alpha Magnetic Spectrometer to ISS; last flight of Endeavour
delivery of ESA-built Permanent Multipurpose Module to ISS; last flight of Atlantis; last space shuttle flight
First Chinese woman in space (Liu Yang); first manned Chinese space docking
Expeditions 43–46 crew (Expeditions 43 and 44; Padalka); longest spaceflight by an American (Kelly, 340 days); most time spent in space (878 days over 5 flights; Padalka)
Expeditions 45 and 46 (Volkov) crew; first Danish astronaut (Mogensen)
first crew on Tiangong 2 space station
Expeditions 50, 51, and 52 (Whitson) crew; longest spaceflight by a woman (289 days, Whitson); most time in space by a woman (665 days over 3 flights, Whitson)
Second stage broke up, forcing emergency landing
first crewed flight of Dragon spacecraft; first U.S. launch since 2011
Expeditions 64 and 65 crew; first operational flight of Dragon spacecraft
Expeditions 64, 65, and 66 (Dubrov, Vande Hei) crew; longest spaceflight by an American (Vande Hei, 355 days)
first crew of Tiangong space station
first spaceflight with only private citizens
Expeditions 65 and 66 crew (Shkaplerov); director Shipenko and actress Peresild shot scenes for a film on the ISS
first private flight to the ISS
planned addition of two modules to Tiangong
